<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/12/s-redstone-family-cbs-viacom?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It’s All in the Redstone Family for CBS and Viacom
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="It’s All in the Redstone Family for CBS and Viacom" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY1NjQ1NDY3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a summer’s worth of “merger imminent” headlines, CBS (-1.80%) and Viacom (-4.91%) may finally reunite. The two media giants are reportedly nearing a deal after the <a href="https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2019-08-12/cbs-viacom-merger-talks-in-the-final-stages-investors-stock-trading?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third such attempt</a> in as many years. When this Brew went to e-print, an agreement was expected to be announced as soon as this morning.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why it makes sense</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CBS is the most-watched U.S. broadcast network and Viacom owns Paramount, MTV, Nickelodeon, and other assets. But waging war on today’s media (and tech-turned-media) competitors takes guts <em>and </em>financial ammo.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Casual TV consumers probably knew Netflix’s </span><span><em>The Crown</em></span><span> announced a season three premiere date yesterday (Nov. 17). But we're guessing your best days of watching Viacom channels are behind you. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Together, CBS/Viacom can better recruit Queen Elizabeth II-level star power...a prerequisite for winning attention in the rapidly consolidating entertainment space.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The details</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CBS and Viacom are <a href="https://www.axios.com/cbs-viacom-merger-deal-talks-bda8e78f-eeaf-4f0b-a388-496d7634fb66.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">preparing</a> for an all-stock transaction. Negotiators were reportedly <a href="http://cnbc.com/2019/08/12/cbs-viacom-negotiating-share-exchange-ratio-between-0point5960-and-0point5965.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">torn between</a> 0.5960 and 0.5965 in CBS shares for each Viacom share, a sticking point that kept execs <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cbs-viacom-night-hammer-deal-043312328.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">working</a> late into the night on Sunday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And by the way, “reunite” wasn’t a typo. CBS and Viacom are both <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-viacom-m-a-cbs/cbs-shareholders-to-get-slight-premium-from-viacom-deal-sources-idUSKCN1V21A3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">controlled</a> by National Amusements, a company owned by media mogul Sumner Redstone and his daughter, Shari.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Back in 2006, Sumner severed a surging Viacom from CBS. In the years since, Viacom’s </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/cbs-viacom-in-final-stages-of-deal-talks-11565614901?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">struggled</a></span><span> as cord-cutters hamstring its cable ratings.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fast forward to today:</strong> Shari runs National Amusements and has for years attempted to ink this kind of deal. But ex-CBS chief Les Moonves, <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/arts-entertainment/2018/12/17/former-cbs-chairman-les-moonves-fired-cause-will-not-receive-severance-wake-sexual-misconduct-allegations/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ousted</a> last year in the wake of sexual misconduct allegations, stood in the way.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the younger Redstone has grander ambitions. She reportedly wants to scale her <em>Succession</em>-like media empire by <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/all/if-cbs-viacom-reunite-more-mergers-could-be-way-n1036476?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acquiring additional businesses</a> (maybe Sony Pictures Entertainment, maybe Discovery Communications) down the road.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/12/hong-kong-s-business-community-wants-everyone-get-along?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hong Kong Business Gets Risky
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTI0LzEyMDBweC1ob25nX2tvbmdfaXNsYW5kX3NreWxpbmVfMjAwOV9qcGcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>WiNG, Hong Kong Island Skyline 2009, CC BY-SA 3.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As protests <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/12/world/asia/hong-kong-airport-protest-cancellations.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ground flights</a> and disrupt public transit, Hong Kong’s political unrest is spilling over into the business world. The turmoil has led to “can’t we all just get along"s from...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Biz leaders. </strong>Some of the city’s billionaires recently <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-12/hong-kong-billionaire-breaks-silence-urges-protesters-to-think?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called for</a> protesters to back down. Peter Woo, the largest shareholder of developer Wheelock, referred to the since-suspended extradition bill that incited the original protests as a “big tree” that has already fallen. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But the protestors have moved past the bill to hit on a larger point—creeping control from Beijing. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Luxury brands. </strong>Red carpet mainstays from Versace to Givenchy have <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2019/08/12/givenchy-versace-big-brands-are-apologizing-china/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">publicly apologized</a> to China in recent days for identifying Hong Kong and other Chinese-claimed territories as independent countries following outcry from prominent mainlanders. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Airlines.</strong> The CEO of Hong Kong’s flag carrier Cathay Pacific <a href="https://apnews.com/0314fae505f04e2197dcbd8b2cfeb76e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sent</a> a note to employees warning that “There will be disciplinary consequences for employees who support or participate in illegal protests.” It appears that Cathay Pacific is complying with China's civil aviation authority’s crackdown on protest participants.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
APPAREL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/12/nike-s-going-full-dtc-kids-sneakers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Nike, Winged Goddess of DTC Subscriptions
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Nike (-0.40%) <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/08/12/nike-launches-a-subscription-service-for-kids-shoes-nike-adventure-club/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced plans</a> to go after the “He started it!” market—kids’ sneakers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that looks like: </strong>A subscription service called Nike Adventure Club that sends customers new shoes periodically. How periodically? Parents can choose between spending $20, $30, or $50 a month. Higher monthly fee = higher frequency of new sneakers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The program is aimed at kids ages 2–10, part of a children's sneaker market estimated to be worth roughly $10 billion per year. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Nike’s <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nike-kids/nike-aims-sneaker-subscriber-scheme-at-10-billion-u-s-kids-market-idUSKCN1V2161?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trying to keep its lead</a> while retro rivals like Fila and Reebok find themselves back in vogue and Kendall Jenner keeps Adidas on solid footing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Too much wiggle room? </strong>For parents, the service offers the welcome convenience of avoiding trips to the store, but that also makes it risky. After all, kids don’t always grow predictably. Nike hopes to make sure the sneakers fit the first time around by sending parents a sizing chart fridge magnet they can consult. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Nike’s hoping the “adventure” in this club is the thrilling journey of lifelong customer-hood. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">P.S. Is it acceptable to still do bunny ears in your mid-20s? </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/12/blue-origin-protesting-air-force-strategy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Bezos Doth Protest Too Much
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTI1L2JsdWVvcmlnaW5fbmV3Z2xlbm5fYWx0ZXJuYXRlMl9qcGcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Blue Origin</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Blue Origin, the rocket ship and space venture company from world’s richest person Jeff Bezos, <a href="http://washingtonpost.com/business/2019/08/12/blue-origin-challenges-pentagons-plan-satellite-launches/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is protesting</a> the Air Force’s approach to finding two companies to launch upcoming national security missions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Blue Origin's gripe: </strong>It told the Government Accountability Office that the Air Force’s current “flawed acquisition strategy” will result in a competition-stifling “duopoly.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>For years the Defense Department </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/blue-origin-protest-air-force-national-security-rocket-launch-6021809c-8aa7-44e6-a2e9-4a8f6934ad4c.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">contracted</a></span><span> with just one company, a joint venture from Boeing and Lockheed Martin called United Launch Alliance.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2014, Elon Musk’s SpaceX filed a lawsuit to be considered. When it eventually settled with the Air Force, SpaceX's entry drove down prices for mission competitions.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But now Blue Origin wants in, and we can’t blame it. The Air Force’s chosen companies will secure billions of dollars in revenue thanks to a 60/40 split of lucrative national security launches from 2022–2026.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But timing is everything. </strong>The Pentagon <a href="https://spacenews.com/blue-origin-files-protest-over-flawed-air-force-launch-procurement/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plans to choose</a> its two providers next year. Blue Origin’s rocket, New Glenn, won’t be ready for flight until 2021.</p>

STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/12/invest-mixhalo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Venture This: Mixhalo
</font></a>
</h1>

<img class="story-header-image" alt="Venture This: Mixhalo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xT0xeCNfoIpUufjMOc/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>In the section, we tell you about a startup making waves. Then, you must make a decision: invest or not to invest? </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You may have heard Paul Simon <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=3&v=ccbSHL8g1Rg&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">brought</a> Bob Weir onstage to close his Outside Lands set...but one startup ensured this weekend's festival was still more 2019 than 1969. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mixhalo, which <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/dbloom/2019/07/24/mixhalo-live-audio-tech-startup-remixes-management-raises-107m-from-major-bands-vcs/#5915edacd91d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed</a> an $11 million Series A last month, was testing its tech under the radar, <a href="https://www.axios.com/experiencing-a-music-festival-with-tech-upgrades-4a64f129-1668-4fac-9b5d-02fb88ed5f62.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports Axios</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How Mixhalo’s trying to make the world a better place: </strong>By ending the frustration of shelling out to see your favorite band...only to get stuck swaying to what sound like whale vocalizations.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mixhalo’s wi-fi networks connect live event attendees directly to the show’s soundboards, so they can hear through headphones the same quality of music that's piped in to musicians' ears. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Its network can accommodate unlimited users, as long as they’re located within a certain range. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s got serious music industry bona fides. Mixhalo was co-founded by Incubus guitarist Mike Einziger and its investors and advisors include Pharrell Williams, Hans Zimmer, Rick Rubin, Metallica, and Baba O’Riley himself. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So, once again we turn to you, wise Andreessen Brewowitz investors. Would you participate in Mixhalo’s next fundraising round? Let us know <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/M2ca2E?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>

Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter a summer’s worth of “merger imminent” headlines, CBS (-1.80%) and Viacom (-4.91%) may finally reunite. The two media giants are reportedly nearing a deal after the \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2019-08-12/cbs-viacom-merger-talks-in-the-final-stages-investors-stock-trading?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethird such attempt\u003c/a\u003e in as many years. When this Brew went to e-print, an agreement was expected to be announced as soon as this morning.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy it makes sense\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCBS is the most-watched U.S. broadcast network and Viacom owns Paramount, MTV, Nickelodeon, and other assets. But waging war on today’s media (and tech-turned-media) competitors takes guts \u003cem\u003eand \u003c/em\u003efinancial ammo.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCasual TV consumers probably knew Netflix’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Crown\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e announced a season three premiere date yesterday (Nov. 17). But we're guessing your best days of watching Viacom channels are behind you. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTogether, CBS/Viacom can better recruit Queen Elizabeth II-level star power...a prerequisite for winning attention in the rapidly consolidating entertainment space.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe details\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCBS and Viacom are \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/cbs-viacom-merger-deal-talks-bda8e78f-eeaf-4f0b-a388-496d7634fb66.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epreparing\u003c/a\u003e for an all-stock transaction. Negotiators were reportedly \u003ca href=\"http://cnbc.com/2019/08/12/cbs-viacom-negotiating-share-exchange-ratio-between-0point5960-and-0point5965.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etorn between\u003c/a\u003e 0.5960 and 0.5965 in CBS shares for each Viacom share, a sticking point that kept execs \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cbs-viacom-night-hammer-deal-043312328.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworking\u003c/a\u003e late into the night on Sunday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd by the way, “reunite” wasn’t a typo. CBS and Viacom are both \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-viacom-m-a-cbs/cbs-shareholders-to-get-slight-premium-from-viacom-deal-sources-idUSKCN1V21A3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtrolled\u003c/a\u003e by National Amusements, a company owned by media mogul Sumner Redstone and his daughter, Shari.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBack in 2006, Sumner severed a surging Viacom from CBS. In the years since, Viacom’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/cbs-viacom-in-final-stages-of-deal-talks-11565614901?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estruggled\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e as cord-cutters hamstring its cable ratings.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFast forward to today:\u003c/strong\u003e Shari runs National Amusements and has for years attempted to ink this kind of deal. But ex-CBS chief Les Moonves, \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/arts-entertainment/2018/12/17/former-cbs-chairman-les-moonves-fired-cause-will-not-receive-severance-wake-sexual-misconduct-allegations/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eousted\u003c/a\u003e last year in the wake of sexual misconduct allegations, stood in the way.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe younger Redstone has grander ambitions. She reportedly wants to scale her \u003cem\u003eSuccession\u003c/em\u003e-like media empire by \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/all/if-cbs-viacom-reunite-more-mergers-could-be-way-n1036476?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eacquiring additional businesses\u003c/a\u003e (maybe Sony Pictures Entertainment, maybe Discovery Communications) down the The turmoil has led to “can’t we all just get along\"s from...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBiz leaders. \u003c/strong\u003eSome of the city’s billionaires recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-12/hong-kong-billionaire-breaks-silence-urges-protesters-to-think?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled for\u003c/a\u003e protesters to back down. fallen. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut the protestors have moved past the as independent countries following outcry from prominent mainlanders. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong Subscriptions\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Nike (-0.40%) \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/08/12/nike-launches-a-subscription-service-for-kids-shoes-nike-adventure-club/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced plans\u003c/a\u003e to go after the “He started it!” market—kids’ sneakers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that looks like: \u003c/strong\u003eA subscription service called Nike Adventure Club that sends customers new shoes periodically. How periodically? Parents can choose between spending $20, $30, or $50 a month. Higher monthly fee = higher frequency of new sneakers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe program is aimed at kids ages 2–10, part of a children's sneaker market estimated to be worth roughly $10 billion per year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eNike’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nike-kids/nike-aims-sneaker-subscriber-scheme-at-10-billion-u-s-kids-market-idUSKCN1V2161?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etrying to keep its lead\u003c/a\u003e while retro rivals like Fila and Reebok find themselves back in vogue and Kendall Jenner keeps Adidas on solid footing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eToo much wiggle room? \u003c/strong\u003eFor parents, the service offers the welcome convenience of avoiding trips to the store, but that also makes it risky. After all, kids don’t always grow predictably. Nike hopes to make sure the sneakers fit the first time around by sending parents a sizing chart fridge magnet they can consult. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eNike’s hoping the “adventure” in this club is the thrilling journey of lifelong customer-hood. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eP.S. Origin\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBlue Origin, the rocket ship and space venture company from world’s richest person Jeff Bezos, \u003ca href=\"http://washingtonpost.com/business/2019/08/12/blue-origin-challenges-pentagons-plan-satellite-launches/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis protesting\u003c/a\u003e the Air Force’s approach to finding two companies to launch upcoming national security missions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBlue Origin's gripe: \u003c/strong\u003eIt told the Government Accountability Office that the Air Force’s current “flawed acquisition strategy” will result in a competition-stifling “duopoly.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFor years the Defense Department \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/blue-origin-protest-air-force-national-security-rocket-launch-6021809c-8aa7-44e6-a2e9-4a8f6934ad4c.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtracted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with just one company, a joint venture from Boeing and Lockheed Martin called United Launch Alliance.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2014, Elon Musk’s SpaceX filed a lawsuit to be considered. When it eventually settled with the Air Force, SpaceX's entry drove down prices for mission competitions.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut now Blue Origin wants in, and we can’t blame it. The Air Force’s chosen companies will secure billions of dollars in revenue thanks to a 60/40 split of lucrative national security launches from 2022–2026.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut timing is everything. \u003c/strong\u003eThe Pentagon \u003ca href=\"https://spacenews.com/blue-origin-files-protest-over-flawed-air-force-launch-procurement/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplans to choose\u003c/a\u003e its two providers next year. href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=3\u0026v=ccbSHL8g1Rg\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebrought\u003c/a\u003e Bob Weir onstage to close his Outside Lands set...but one startup ensured this weekend's festival was still more 2019 than 1969. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMixhalo, which \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/dbloom/2019/07/24/mixhalo-live-audio-tech-startup-remixes-management-raises-107m-from-major-bands-vcs/#5915edacd91d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosed\u003c/a\u003e an $11 million Series A last month, was testing its tech under the radar, \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/experiencing-a-music-festival-with-tech-upgrades-4a64f129-1668-4fac-9b5d-02fb88ed5f62.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports Axios\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow Mixhalo’s trying to make the world a better place: \u003c/strong\u003eBy ending the frustration of shelling out to see your favorite band...only to get stuck swaying to what sound like whale vocalizations.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMixhalo’s wi-fi networks connect live event attendees directly to the show’s soundboards, so they can hear through headphones the same quality of music that's piped in to musicians' ears. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIts network can accommodate unlimited users, as long as they’re located within a certain range. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s got serious music industry bona fides. Mixhalo was co-founded by Incubus guitarist Mike Einziger and its investors and advisors include Pharrell Williams, Hans Zimmer, Rick Rubin, Metallica, and Baba O’Riley himself. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo, once again we turn to you, wise Andreessen Brewowitz investors.
